column4: someone please tell me how to install ubuntu on a machine without an internet connection
put the install CD in and boot :)
copy the files to a cd. mount it on the network-disabled pc. "sudo dpkg -i packagename.deb" to install the files
copy what files to the cd?
the files you want to install on the PC of course. you can also add the CD to /etc/apt/sources.list
where to download additional cd images from?
breezy install cd can be obtained from www.ubuntu.com
hang on
check that out
don't i need a fast internet connection to install packages from there?
nope, you can download manually from the repos own sites.
what is the procedure to download?
just choose from the specific sites what you want and burn them on a cd.
what do you mean?
i need to to right-click and save each individual file?
yeah, that is the manual way
isn't there an image file or something like that?
.iso files or 700MB-800MB files?
you just said you did not want an image. i don't know if it exist for the repos. you must check the individual sites yourself.
you must check yourself. i do not know since i never needed to do that.
they usually set up a fileserver that the individual computers fetch the files from
the packages from the install-cd and some other downloaded packages probably. maybe the wiki's got what you are looking for.
